fields.headline: Joe Cole factfile
fields.bodyText: 1981: Born Camden, November 8 1998: Signed professional forms with West Ham. 1999: January - Made first team debut when coming off the bench in the FA Cup tie with Swansea at Upton Park. May - Influential in helping the Hammers win the FA Youth Cup with two-legged final win over Coventry. Went on to play in games at Wimbledon and Liverpool, and came off the bench in three of the remaining five games of the season. November - Scored first goal for first team in Worthington Cup, his late tap-in booking the Hammers' place in the next round. 2000 February - Scored first Premiership goal in 5-4 victory over Bradford at Upton Park. March - Signed long-term deal with Hammers, tying him to Upton Park until 2004. April - Season ended after 22-game run when he broke leg in a challenge with Rory Delap in 2-1 win at Derby. September - Named in squad for friendly international with France in Paris, but failed to play. October - Made England squad for World Cup qualifier against Finland, but again failed to figure. Season ended later in the month after he damaged an ankle in game against Newcastle. 2001 February 12 - Scored eight minutes from time in 1-1 Premiership draw with Coventry. February 29 - Named in Sven-Goran Eriksson's first England squad for the friendly with Spain at Villa Park, but does not play. May 25 - Makes England debut as a substitute in 4-0 win over Mexico at Pride Park. 2002 June - Selected in England's World Cup squad. Makes one appearance, as a substitute in the 1-1 draw with Sweden. 2003 June 3 - Scores first goals for England in 2-1 win over Serbia and Montenegro at Walker's Stadium, the most recent of his 10 international appearances. July 24 - Charged by the Football Association with misconduct following incidents during and after West Ham's defeat at Bolton in April. August 5 - West Ham agree a £6.6million fee with Chelsea for Cole.
